fields.description:
In 4.3.0, SELinux will be supported for all Euca cloud services. This doc ticket is to track decisions and progress on the docs that support SELinux. Relates to EUCA-10478 (and EUCA-11539).

Reference material:  https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/7/html/SELinux_Users_and_Administrators_Guide/chap-Security-Enhanced_Linux-Troubleshooting.html

comments.body: [~gholms] is there a source of info for the v important blocker status content? thank you :)
[~dmitrii] is this a candidate for "Controlled Availability" ?

[~gholms] I made changes per the commits you can see.

QUESTIONs -
# Where is the policy file and what do we need to tell customers about it for Euca 4.3?
# http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#shared/img_task_prepare_image.html has a bit about disabling SELinux (DOC-1864 ack that this doc prob needs work) - let me know what to do with this content.
# http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#security-guide/security_bp_host.html best practice note about disabling SELinux - keep or modify?
# http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#security-guide/security_bp_instances.html opposite recommendation to enable it?
[~kmeredith], I don't think SELinux is something we only want to support under certain circumstances. So, I would say, no to Controlled Availability.

Eucalyptus's packages will automatically install the SELinux policy on RHEL 7 and CentOS 7.  No action is required to make that happen.

----

Please remove everything that instructs one to disable SELinux on the systems that run the Eucalyptus services themselves, except where necessary to support RHEL 6 and CentOS 6, which that feature does not support.  Bits that refer to image preparation are unaffected by this feature, as they are limited to what goes on inside of instances.  That said, I personally think we should either encourage people to leave SELinux enabled or not mention it at all.

----

It is necessary to set two booleans on various machines, depending on which services go where:

On storage controllers, set the {{eucalyptus_storage_controller}} boolean to allow Eucalyptus to manage EBS volumes:

{code}setsebool -P eucalyptus_storage_controller 1{code}

On cloud controllers in VPCMIDO networking mode, and on all systems running the Management Console, set the {{httpd_can_network_connect}} boolean to allow those services' HTTP proxies to access their respective back ends:

{code}setsebool -P httpd_can_network_connect 1{code}
Take note of the {{1}} at the end of each {{setsebool}} command.  It was not in your notes.

1. a. Updated - please review and provide feedback:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#install-guide/configure_selinux.html
1. b. Note that there's a section in this doc about disabling SELinux in case you need to for RHEL 6 for example. 
* are the instructions correct for disabling?
* are there any hidden gotchas related to SELinux and upgrade to 4.3 / downgrade to 4.2 or mid-upgrade with RHEL 7 and RHEL 6 in the same cloud?
* are there more prereqs to note?
(should create a separate disable selinux topic I think)

2. Removed sub-step 2c, disable selinux:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#shared/img_task_prepare_image.html
(previous version http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2//index.html#shared/img_task_prepare_image.html )
3. Removed note about disabling selinux:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#security-guide/security_bp_host.html
(previous version http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2//index.html#security-guide/security_bp_host.html )
4. No change to selinux reference here; let me know if there should be an update:
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#security-guide/security_bp_instances.html
5. Will DOC-1857, admin guide changes for SELinux for 4.3.1, include info on what to do with the policy file?

btw [~gholms] should we be adding these commands to the SC, CLC, and Mgmt Console start topics, too? e.g.,
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/starting_euca_sc.html

[~gholms] ^ see 2 previous comments - plus a comment from [~tsugawa] - 

Configure SELinux (http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/configure_selinux.html)
It is not clear what is Eucalyptus’ position wrt SELinux. Is it recommended, mandatory, users’ choice?
If new installs require RHEL7, mentioning RHEL6 in this section may be confusing.

If you think mentioning RHEL 6 and CentOS 6 would only make things more confusing I think it's fine to remove it.  As for our recommendation of what to do with SELinux, how does, "We recommend enabling SELinux on systems running Eucalyptus services to improve their security," sound?  Now that I think about it, that part may not be necessary either.

I think we should have a section dedicated to configuring SELinux on all machines or an entry in the "starting" sections for each of the relevant services, but not both.  The former is more annoying, but the latter is easier to miss for non-first-time readers.

A few edits for the "Configure SELinux" page:
# SELinux stands for Security-Enhanced Linux, not Security-Enabled Linux.
# The last sentence of the introductory paragraph is likely better worded as, "Eucalyptus packages automatically install SELinux policy for Eucalyptus on RHEL 7 and CentOS 7."
# The introductory paragraph appears twice.  I would get rid of the second copy.
# There is only one cloud controller, making "on each Cloud Controller" sound a bit silly.
# "Cloud Controller (CC)" should instead be "Cloud Controller (CLC)".

a. [~gholms] Fixing # 1,2,4,5 in the next commit. Need to rework DITA files to fix # 3. Moving the topic down to Configure the Runtime Environment section, to address Lincoln's email question about placement (and the leaving the prereq as is, since these instructions do not work on 4.2 / RHEL 6). Is it OK _after_ Start and Register sections?
b. Could put a Note in the Start topics. Speaking of non-first-time readers, I think we need to say something in the Upgrade section about SELinux [~lincoln.thomas].
c. Am thinking of moving to an appendix the RHEL 6 version of SELinux topic / disable (for the expected-rare case of 4.3 on RHEL 6). 
d. We have not addressed [~tsugawa]'s concern about "Is it recommended, mandatory, users’ choice?" in the topic, or the release notes mention. We should probably put it somewhere.
e. Also, does SELinux deserve a row of its own in the [Release Notes|http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#release-notes/4.3.0/4.3.0_rn_features.html]?

I have no idea where that prerequisite came from, because it is incorrect.  You have to configure SELinux booleans after installing packages, but before starting services.  By the time things are registered it is too late and your storage controllers are already broken.

To be completely honest, I am not convinced that we need to say anything either way about whether or not one should use SELinux.  If anything, simply saying that we recommend using it would suffice.  It certainly isn't mandatory, but when it is enabled it can help contain break-ins.

Mentioning SELinux support in the release notes sounds like a great idea.

Updated where the topic appears (after install, before start). Also cleaned up the context wording for GA. 

Need to have a conversation with [~gholms] to finalize this topic. [~dmitrii] will help sort out positioning in the docs.

cc [~rusvika].
email from gholms: That looks fine to me!  I also noticed an unrelated section we can eliminate entirely, so I filed a bug while I was at it.
